definition: seat/base/stand/CL:個|个[ge4]/classifier for buildings, mountains and similar immovable objects

sentences.english: 3Yet you are enthroned as the Holy One; you are the praise of Israel.
sentences.chinese: 但你是聖潔的，是用以色列的讚美爲寶座的。

sentences.english: On both sides of the seat were armrests , with a lion standing beside each of them.
sentences.chinese: 寶座兩旁有扶手，靠近扶手有兩個獅子站立。

sentences.english: He is the true prince who finds his throne in the heart of the dervish.
sentences.chinese: 在托鉢僧的心中找到自己的寶座的是真正的王子。

sentences.english: It may sunder the thrones of gods.
sentences.chinese: 它可以擊破衆神的寶座。

sentences.english: Who will grant me that I might know and find him, and come even to his throne?
sentences.chinese: 惟願我知道怎樣能尋到天主，能到達他的寶座前。

sentences.english: On the throne sits God who has a book with seven seals.
sentences.chinese: 上帝坐在寶座上，拿着一本有七個封印的書。

sentences.english: The students excited are describing in Imperial Palace's that golden small tinkling bell throne.
sentences.chinese: 學生們正在興奮的描述故宮裏的那個金鑾寶座。

sentences.english: First Rafael Correa, the leftist economist, won the presidency.
sentences.chinese: 首先拉斐爾科雷亞，左派經濟學家，贏得總統寶座。

sentences.english: So what is the immortal legend of taro push tens of thousands of people lost the throne?
sentences.chinese: 那麼是什麼把仙芋傳奇推上萬人迷的寶座呢？

sentences.english: Zeus, sitting on his throne, saw with alarm how strong man was becoming.
sentences.chinese: 宙斯坐在寶座上看到人類逐漸強大起來，非常驚訝。

sentences.english: You knew of the time Nebuchadnezzar's pride cost him his mind and his throne.
sentences.chinese: 你知道尼布甲尼撒的驕傲令他失去理智和寶座。

sentences.english: It is called the river of life and flows from the throne of God.
sentences.chinese: 它被稱爲生命河，從神的寶座流出來。

sentences.english: And we have in Ancient Near Eastern iconography thrones of this type.
sentences.chinese: 在古近東時期的肖像研究中我們看見過這樣的寶座。

sentences.english: Would you picture a grey-bearded, elderly gentleman perched on a throne?
sentences.chinese: 你會否想象一個白髮老人，滿面鬍子，坐在寶座上？

sentences.english: Then the king made a great throne inlaid with ivory and overlaid with pure gold.
sentences.chinese: 王用象牙製造一個大寶座，用精金包裹。

sentences.english: St. Cyril did not last long on the throne of St.
sentences.chinese: 聖西里爾並沒有在聖馬可的寶座上持續很長時間。

definition: to fight over/to contest/to vie over
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
lit. to proclaim oneself hegemon/to take a leading role/to build a personal fiefdom
to reveal one's talent (idiom)/to rise above others/to distinguish oneself
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to promote to a higher position
